Articles.Content: No, if you post a picture of any stealth plane which is not your prototype you get 5 points. Heck, you could post your F-22- it's stealth, right? See above, or Mad Rocket Scientist's F-19 entry.

> 
> No, if you post a picture of any stealth plane which is not your prototype you get 5 points. Heck, you could post your F-22- it's stealth, right? See above, or Mad Rocket Scientist's F-19 entry.

Oh dang, so like, can I do more than one? I was gonna make a B-2 as well XD F-35 is considered stealth too right?

I would post screenshots, but I can make ascii art that has better graphics than the old laptop. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Progress, I've made a 1-ton JDAM. Fin guidance.

I'll be building this from the bomb bay outwards.

EDIT:

![5uMC8fq.png](http://i.imgur.com/5uMC8fq.png)

> Oh dang, so like, can I do more than one? I was gonna make a B-2 as well XD F-35 is considered stealth too right?

It's obsolete ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) but it's still a stealth fighter, so yes. Remember to post the teaser of a non-prototype!

Gosh darn it, it has too much drag.

EDIT:

Was the real one more stable upside-down? This one is.

I don't even...

![EIe8g8z.png](http://i.imgur.com/EIe8g8z.png)
Looks like you're also shooting for Wobblin' Goblin. Keep it up!
well, given the wingform, with no dihedral or anhedral wing shape, it's no wonder it's more stable upside down ^^

IT'S SO BUGGY! ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

Half of it seems to generate more drag than the other, the bombs will NOT decouple at the same time, airbrake bomb bays won't respond to action groups... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

EDIT:

What the heck?! I said *don't* respond to the brakes key, you stupid little things! FIVE TIMES!

![MTGq7Vj.png](http://i.imgur.com/MTGq7Vj.png)

Grrrrrr... ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-19T16:29:01Z" title="05/19/2015 04:29  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 19, 2015</time> by Starwhip**

the airbrakes are bugged currently ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) you can't unbind them from 'brake' ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> the airbrakes are bugged currently ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) you can't unbind them from 'brake' ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Gosh durn it.

Welp, I'm scrapping this one. Can't fly it. Can't land it.

This doesn't help:

![DXZuTdq.png](http://i.imgur.com/DXZuTdq.png)

I'll try structural panels next time.

Why don't you just use a Mk 2 bay for a bomb pod and build the plane around it? That's what My plans are anyways. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Why don't you just use a Mk 2 bay for a bomb pod and build the plane around it? That's what My plans are anyways. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Because the bottom of the real F-117 is flat, and the MK2 bay is not.

Though, it would be a helluva lot simpler to do it like that...

> 
> Because the bottom of the real F-117 is flat, and the MK2 bay is not.
> Though, it would be a helluva lot simpler to do it like that...

With some cleverness, you could still use the bay and make the bottom flat. I believe in you. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> With some cleverness, you could still use the bay and make the bottom flat. I believe in you. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Darn you! Don't believe in me!

![O7tDtjm.png](http://i.imgur.com/O7tDtjm.png)
Starwhip, this is a lot of fun to watch. Keep up the headbanging! ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

![rk9qEOU.png](http://i.imgur.com/rk9qEOU.png)

Okay, engines are go.

Now to somehow make an outside frame... ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)
As I said, really, really fun to watch. Did you completely restart your build, or was that just me?

> 
> As I said, really, really fun to watch. Did you completely restart your build, or was that just me?

Nope. Not just you.

This one is 100% better! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Just did a test run. Flies like a charm. (No yaw control, though. Reaction wheels time! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))
Now I can give you the 5 points for F-19, b/c your plane was scrapped and rebuilt from the ground up. What dedication!
![1ihnBGE.png](http://i.imgur.com/1ihnBGE.png)

280 parts.

Anyhoo, tallying my craft as is...

1 Crew Member -- 100 points

Fly By Wire AVH - 50 Points

Two Engines -- 100 Points

BtB1 (20m Length) -- 10 Points

BtB2 (13.2m Width) -- 10 Points

BtB3 (3.7m Height) -- 10 Points

Signed by the Author -- 15 Points

F-19 -- 5 Points

JDAM -- 10 Points

Grand Total -- 310 Points

I can get pics up tomorrow.
